intro: Chelonespermum minus, commonly known as the lesser chelone, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a herbaceous perennial, often found in rocky or sandy soils. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
